Class PlanetarySystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlanetarySystem
  • public class PlanetarySystem
extends java.lang.Object
    The PlanetarySystem class represents a hierarchical structure of celestial bodies including a central star, planets, and their satellites (moons). It stores environmental sensor data for each node and provides methods to add planets/satellites, analyze radiation anomalies, retrieve paths, and print reports.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlanetarySystem​(java.lang.String starName, double temperature, double pressure, double humidity, double radiation)
      Constructs a planetary system with a single star node as the root.

      Adds a satellite (moon) to a planet node.
      java.util.List<Node> findRadiationAnomalies​(double threshold)
      Finds all nodes in the planetary system with radiation greater than the given threshold.
      java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> getPathTo​(java.lang.String planetName)
      Retrieves the path to the specified planet as a stack of node names.
      void printMissionReport()
      Prints a detailed mission report for all nodes in the system.

      Prints a mission report for a specific node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlanetarySystem

        public PlanetarySystem​(java.lang.String starName,
                       double temperature,
                       double pressure,
                       double humidity,
                       double radiation)
        Constructs a planetary system with a single star node as the root.
        Parameters:
        starName - the name of the star
        temperature - temperature of the star in Kelvin
        pressure - pressure of the star in Pascals (must be non-negative)
        humidity - must be 0 for a star
        radiation - radiation level in Sieverts (must be non-negative)

    • Method Detail

      • addPlanet

        public void addPlanet​(java.lang.String planetName,
                      java.lang.String parentName,
                      double temperature,
                      double pressure,
                      double humidity,
                      double radiation)
        Adds a planet to the specified parent node in the system.
        Parameters:
        planetName - name of the planet
        parentName - name of the parent node (must be a star or planet)
        temperature - temperature of the planet
        pressure - pressure of the planet (non-negative)
        humidity - humidity of the planet (0-100)
        radiation - radiation level of the planet (non-negative)

      • addSatellite

        public void addSatellite​(java.lang.String satelliteName,
                         java.lang.String parentName,
                         double temperature,
                         double pressure,
                         double humidity,
                         double radiation)
        Adds a satellite (moon) to a planet node.
        Parameters:
        satelliteName - name of the satellite
        parentName - name of the parent planet
        temperature - temperature of the satellite
        pressure - pressure of the satellite (non-negative)
        humidity - humidity of the satellite (0-100)
        radiation - radiation level of the satellite (non-negative)

      • findRadiationAnomalies

        public java.util.List<Node> findRadiationAnomalies​(double threshold)
        Finds all nodes in the planetary system with radiation greater than the given threshold.
        Parameters:
        threshold - the radiation threshold (must be non-negative)
        Returns:
        a list of nodes with high radiation

      • getPathTo

        public java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> getPathTo​(java.lang.String planetName)
        Retrieves the path to the specified planet as a stack of node names.
        Parameters:
        planetName - the name of the target node
        Returns:
        a stack representing the path from the root to the target node

      • printMissionReport

        public void printMissionReport()
        Prints a detailed mission report for all nodes in the system.

      • printMissionReport

        public void printMissionReport​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Prints a mission report for a specific node.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - the name of the node
